WRITING.TITLE: My home system is gone
WRITING.TEXT: (Sorry in advance if this topic was already been discussed) I've just returned to NMS to see what is new and the first thing I have to say is that HG did an awesome job to elaborate the game. The first visit in the new anomaly was awesome! But I have a huge problem with the new update: My home system, and some others too, are gone. The only way to get access on the systems is via space station teleport. They don't exist in the galactic map anymore and were apparently replaced by new systems (which are all titled as "discovered"). So when I travel via space station to my home system (where my base is located) and access to the galactic map, it says that I'm in a different system which is not my home system. Also, there were 5 planets in my home system before the update, now there are only 3 planets left in the system. There is also no way to travel to the nearest system (always out of jump range) or to make a waypoint to my home system (it disappears as soon as I access the galactic map). There was no reset of the universe right? Because this would be the only logical explanation imo. My latest save was from NEXT. Is there any solution to the problem or does anyone have the same problem?

Yes, I am on PS4 and in Euclid. Okay, I did just that. The coordinates of my home system are 042B:0078:0D55:014F Then I converted the coordinates into glyphs and traveled via portal (yes, I got the Atlas error) and the "new" coordinates are 042B:0078:0D55:00AF (the exact same, except the last three digits). Then I calculated both coordinates with the Pilgrim Star Path app and the locations are both exact the same. Weird.

WRITING.TITLE: Spotify in Death Stranding
WRITING.TEXT: Since we know that we can build little "outposts" in the world of Death Stranding, where we can select songs from our ingame playlist to play, so that other players can discover and hear these songs, wouldn't it be cool if we could connect our Spotify account with the game, so that we can select songs or playlists from our Spotify for specific outposts, so that other players can discover our Spotify songs/playlists? (only audible at the outposts of course, we can not "collect" this songs) From a technical perspective, I see no reason why this would not work, especially because Sony and Spotify have a partnership (so there should be no problems with licenses). What would be the **advantages**? - A literally unlimited number of songs to discover. - We can influence each other, like Kojima did with Low Roar, Silent Poets and Apocalyptica. - We can enjoy our own favorite songs in the game, in a more immersive way than just having Spotify running in the background. - It would be another sort of 4th wall breaking that allows us to connect via "real life" music. What would be the **disadvantages**? - It could require PS Plus, although I honestly see no reason for it. - Ingame music would be meaningless. - Some songs could destroy the immersion of the game or just annoy the player. - Adverts? Usually you have adverts in the free version of Spotify. Adverts in the game while listening to a Spotify playlist would definetely be a big immersion killer. What do you guys think? Will/could this be possible in the final game? And would you like it, or would you rather only listen to the ingame songs and the original soundtrack?
Yes, that is my fear too. I really like the idea of connecting via music, but everyone has their own taste in music.

That's absolutely right. Range in fact does increase (or reduce) damage but it's not shown in the weapon stats (the weapons stats a generally broken). Usually the damage difference should only be noticeable over longer distances (as we know it from shotguns) but it's broken and the distance doesn't matter. So with the right attachments you can make a 2 shot gun into a 1 shot gun, regardless of distance. I don't know why you get downvoted for asking the real questions here.

You have your scenario in OP's video. In his first attempt he used a Cronen C480 Pro Optic visor on his EBR-14. This visor reduces the range (as you can see in the weapon stats). On his second attempt there was a Canted Hybrid visor on the gun, which doesn't reduce the range (as you can also see in the weapon stats).

But there were two different visors on the gun. One that reduces the range (the Cronen C480 Pro Optic) and one that doesn't reduce the range (the Canted Hybrid). Cronen C480 Pro Optic = 2 shot Canted Hybrid = 1 shot I think that's the answer. This game logic sucks.

Yes, that's exactly how it's supposed to be, but as you can see in the video the distance is too short to make a real difference (especially for a marksman rifle), so you can literally say that the second visor (which doesn't reduce the range) ensures that the damage is higher at the same distance (even if that's not technically the case). Edit: So it has nothing to do with the blueprint, that's what I mean.

Go to your class editor and you can see that some visors change the range of your gun. Not only that. It's 3 dimensional aiming (stick/thumb) vs. 2 dimensional aiming (mouse/arm). Purely from a biological perspective (how our brain works) you have always an advantage when using mouse amp; keyboard, so that's why controller players need an assist to compensate that. You can be a good player even without aim assist, sure, but you'll never have a fair competition against someone who uses mouse amp; keyboard, unless you're a cyborg.

Professional gamers are cyborgs or what? They still have the same brain as we, didn't they? You don't even understand why aim assist is a thing... It has nothing to do with skill at all. It's because how our brain handles 3D aiming (on controller) and 2D aiming (on mouse) different, so an aim assist is required to compensate the difference.

Yesterday he complained about controller aim assist (Modern Warfare), although aim assist is not working at the moment (it's bugged after last week's update, so there is no aim assist). It was hard to watch.

It's okay to use aim assist because controller players have to deal with a 3 dimensional stick instead of a 2 dimensional mouse. That's it. There are many studies who can explain you further why aim assist is so important. It has a lot to do with how our brain works, it's not just a stupid feature to make it easier for controller players, there's so much more to it.

That's because the pictures weren't actually live. Even if it was an inside job, wouldn't it be stupid to give the media a transcript about the upcoming events? That would be a huge giveaway and would have been leaked by now. Whoever was responsible for 9/11 did a great job to manipulate the information and footage that was given to the media (who then unknowingly manipulated the entire world). To give them information about something that didn't even happen yet would be an amateur move.

1. Just because there's "LIVE" in the corner that doesn't mean that it's actually live. Hell, there are even late night shows who are recorded on afternoon but still has "LIVE" in the corner. "Live pictures" are a lie for itself. Even today, in 2020, you have delays between 30 seconds and two minutes when it comes to live broadcasts, not even to speak of 2001. The most live interviews you see in the news are also pre recorded. 2. Everything that shows up on screen and overlaps the raw footage (these so called "live pictures") has basically nothing to do with the footage itself. So just because the announcement was too early that doesn't mean that it couldn't have happened yet. That just proofs that this footage wasn't live or had a massive delay. 3. Which source? Can you provide a link? Everybody who does some research and has a functional brain will quickly notice that 9/11 was an inside job. But back then, when the internet wasn't etablished yet, TV, radio and newspaper were the only sources which people could get news from. So it was relative simple to manipulate the dissemination of information and it worked. The whole world believed it back then (sure, there were some doubters here and there, but not nearly as many as of today). Even today, you can't question these events in the public, it's still a no-go, although meanwhile 70% of U.S. americans do not believe in the original version which was potrayed by the media and the U.S. government. So I would say they did a great job back then, but in retrospective, of course, that's a joke and so easy to see through.

Yes, control of the media by giving them manipulated/edited/out of context footage. You have to control the media without them even know to be controlled. I believe to 100% that it was an inside job, BUT I don't believe that the media got some sort of a script for the events. That would be stupid and so easy to uncover.

This is absolutely ridiculous. I live in germany and know some of the production staff from Dark. This series was never meant to be that successful. It's a very small team that worked on the series compared to other TV productions (especially compared to other Netflix productions). Almost all actors are known for low budget films/series in Germany. Taking all this into account, it's even more impressive how well the series did for 3 seasons. To think that Kojima had his hands in this projekt is absolutely ridiculous. But I tell you something. Some of the staff there are also huge fans of Kojima's work (he is quite popular here in Germany) like you and I. They have similar interests in literature and films as Kojima, that's why you see the same references in Dark and in Kojima's work. If there is a ruse, Dark is not part of it, I can guarantee you that.

"Give me an answer" was a direct homage to the ruse, you can't deny that. The ruse isn't that big of a secret tbh. All these subjects where there long before Kojima made his very first game. If you have the same interests it's not that unlikely that you come up with the same ideas. I think it's mix of concidences and conscious innuendos. For example, when you are offered to made a series, wouldn't you took some inspiration from Kojima's work when the setting allows it? You would. I think that happened with Dark as well. I really appreciate what you are doing for this sub. You are one of the last ones left here trying to solve the ruse and I respect that. But I think - in all honesty with you - that Dark is a dead end.
It's all about mentality. They never stop to press and attack their opponent, even if they lead 4:1.
The years of decline are knocking on our door anyway (even with Dybala), so I would take the triple before we hit rock bottom.

This. The italian football is so outdated, it's no wonder that the last european title win from an italian team was 10 years ago. We have to change our philosophy in italy to be successful again in europe and we as Juve should be the role model for that, not Atalanta.

That's a winner mentality. You have to make you opponent as uncomfortable as possible so that they're scared to play their game. Then it's only a matter of time before they make mistakes. We are far away from this mentality. I hope Pirlo can change that.
Right. Sarri lost the locker room months ago. There was no way to continue with Sarri.

I think people look too much into the 8:2. Every remaining CL team would have won easily against Barca yesterday. Barca just had the worst performance in CL history. Lyon will be much harder to beat for Bayern.
The same happened at Chelsea last year. It really makes you think... Is Sarri that difficult to deal with? I think he lacks charisma, but otherwise, I think he is not that bad.
I think Allegri would be the perfect coach if Pep would leave (which is very unlikely).

It's like in school. There is always that one teacher that has absolutely no authority at all, because he lost his students in the same second as he entered the class room for the very first time. It's called lack of charisma. This was the same situation with Sarri. He lost the locker room from the beginning and there was no way to reverse this. I think that was the main reason why he got sacked and it was the right decision.

That may seems weird but after that 8:2 I'm much more relaxed about our situation, because there are top teams who struggle even more than us (Barca, City...). We just won our 9th scudetto in the row and yes we underperformed in the CL, but we didn't embarrassed ourselves, we just didn't find a way to make Sarriball work at Juve. Sarri is gone now, with Pirlo on the horizon. I think it could be much worse than that. Let's see what our management does in this transfer window and how Pirlo will effect the team. Fino alla fine!

Maybe "perfect" was the wrong word, but Allegri would be the right coach to reach that damn CL final. His teams don't play the most beautiful football but are always motivated and have the right mindset to perform well in the CL.

There's no way Pep leaves anyway (neither should he), I only said that Allegri would be a good coach to fulfill the CL ambitions if Pep would leave the club, which - as I said before - is very unlikely.

I like the idea of a 4-2-1-3 (4-2-3-1). With this we could play CR7, Dybala and Kulu in the same formation and also improve our midfield by minimizing it (we only have 2 decent midfielders anyway). I think this would work for important games, but could be a problem in the long term (when it comes to rotation). We need more players on that positions to make it a permanent formation we can rely on. We played a similiar formation in our 2016/17 season.

This would be historic and even more worthy than a CL win. Think about all the popularity Juve would gain. Even in 50 years from now, people would talk about it. "Do you remember when CR7 and Messi both played for Juve?" "Yeah sure. They didn't win shit and the rest of the team was absolutely garbage, but it was fun to watch."

I'm not a huge fan of a 3-man defense. We need a formation that we can play regardless of the competition. A 3-man defense is like suicide in the CL. We failed with a 3-man defense (in 2013, 2014 and in the CL final 2017) and Guardiola also failed to successfully implement a 3-man defense in the CL (with Bayern and City). A 3-man defense is definitely not the way to go in the CL.
It's because the most top teams play wide formations. Look at Juve vs. Bayern 2013 or Juve vs. Real 2017, they completely destroyed us with their wingbacks.

We played 3-5-2 in 2013 (2x 0:2 against Bayern) and 2014 (we didn't even pass the group stage). Allegri then changed to a 4-3-1-2 in 2015 and we made it to the final (in the final we also played in that formation). After 2015, Allegri changed the formation again to a 4-2-3-1 (we lost again against Bayern, but we were way more competitive this time and a bit unlucky). In 2017 we won 3:0 against Barca and again made it to the final... But then, for some reason, Allegri changed back to a 3-5-2 formation and we got destroyed by Real (1:4, I will never forget that day). Guardiola made the exact same mistake against Lyon.
We need a target man. Someone like Benzema or Lukaku, not another Dybala.

I will always support italian clubs in europe. A strong Milan (either Inter or AC) was always beneficial for the league and Juve. We need that rivalry to grow beyond us. It's the exact reason why Barca and Real are on the top. It wouldn't be possible without the competition. That's sport in its purest form.
For the same reason why Real regards Zidane as their legend.
I don't get it. What are we looking for exactly? Are we looking for a back-up striker or a starter?

As much as I hate Inter, I hope Inter wins today and makes our life a misery next saison. That's the only way our management wakes the fuck up. We are not even close to win the CL. Not with this laughable team. If everything stays the same, nothing will change. We need a strong competitor in Italy to be successful in Europe. Look at Spain, England, or even Germany (BVB is the reason why Bayern became such a dominant machine). Without that competition, we won't win the CL in the near future. It's like playing FIFA on amateur and then wanting to win the FIFA eWorld Cup.

You could better found a new club with all these players than to sell every single one of them. But I find it funny that Paratici became a victim of his own sins. He has to correct his own mistakes now.

Why did we win 9 scudettos in a row? Because we are Juve? Sure. Because we had the best team in Italy every year? Absolutely. But the main reason why we became so dominant is because of our pre 2011 era. I always said it and I will say it now: Without calciopoli, we would have experienced the same fate as Inter and Milan. We wouldn't have 38 scudettos now. Calciopoli was the best thing that could happen to us. We started to think differently. We build our own stadium, did set up a new president, Marotta and Nedved joined our board, Conte became our coach etc. etc... We did some smart decisions in these years. But the most important thing was hunger. I never saw a hungrier team than our 2011/12 squad. Something that we have lost on the road since. I don't see this hunger today when it comes to the CL. But that's exactly what you need to win the CL. Look at Bayern now. This Juve team almost feels like it doesn't even care anymore. We got careless. What this team (and the board!) needs is a fucking wake up call. We have to remember these years of absence, were Inter and Milan dominated everything. That's what we need right now, to find to our path of success again. Otherwise, if we stay asleep, we won't be competitive for a very long time. NOW is the time to make changes, not when CR7 retires. Competition is everything in sport. It's the reason why sport even exists. You are always as good as your greatest rival. You have to see the bigger picture here.

We are not shit, we are careless. That's why I hope for a better competition. When our board isn't capable of motivating our players to do better, then we need a competition to do so. But that also means that our board has failed. And when our board isn't even capable to buy new players that fit our mentality and to offload all that deadwood, than it has failed even more so. With said, I agree, Paratici should get the fuck out of here.
4-2-1-3 is the way to go. CR7 - Dzeko - Kulusevski up front, Dybala as a deep 10.

Comparing Lewandowski with Neymar, Messi and Ronaldo is laughable. He had some good seasons in the Bundesliga, but he's not a big game player. Never was, never will be. His 4 goals against Real are his greatest achievement in his career. He didn't win shit, except the Bundesliga (without competition). M #252;ller is miles ahead of Lewandowski. A CL winner, a world champion and one of the greatest team players Germany has ever seen. You can say the same about Neuer. Both are legends and can make a difference tonight.

You know, money isn't everything. People are dreaming for years of seeing Messi und Ronaldo in the same jersey. It would be stupid from a financial point of view, but we are football fans, not shareholders. I'm also not a fan of signing Messi, but I can totally understand everybody who is. This is beyond money.
Dybala is wasted on the wing.
Not a bad idea.

Also Juve fan here. I did exactly the same. Cardiff was much worse imo. Also, as a club, we never recovered from that loss didn't we? PSG on the other hand has the player material to challenge for the title again next year, provided that Tuchel stays. They're on par with Bayern, today's game showed that.

You will get your chance again. Remember when Milan lost to Liverpool? When Bayern lost to Chelsea? When Atletico lost to Real? Or when Juve lost to Barca? They all came back stronger to play another final. So will PSG. That may sound odd now, but there's nothing more motivating than losing a CL final.

We don't need another selfish player. We need someone who can support Ronaldo like Benzema did at Real. With Ronaldo we already have the best goalscorer, we don't need a top striker who scores 25+ goals per season.

I think we already had the right striker with Mandzukic. He's such a good teamplayer, it's a shame that he left the club the way he did. He's now available for free, but I don't think he wants to come back. Also, he's in his mid 30s. There are almost no young strikers on the market who can fit into that role. We could try to get Benzema, but I don't think Real wants to sell him (also, same problem as with Mandzukic, he's not getting younger). Firmino is another one. He's one of the less selfish players and is "only" 28 years old. But the most realistic player at this point is Milik. He's 26 years old and can also fit into that role. But to be honest, we don't even know what kind of player Pirlo is looking for. Is he looking for a starter, or a substitute player? We don't even know if Dybala will be a starter under Pirlo. So it's very hard to pick a player from an outside perspective.
Dzeko could be a Tevez 2.0 situation. A good player for 1-2 seasons. I like that idea, but I'm scared that he becomes another problem for us (like Higuain).
I think he keeps the 44.
Haha, Conte wouldn't even use him, because of his work rate. Same reason why Eriksen is benched.

I would. Not because I don't like Dybala, but because I think that Dybala doesn't fit our playing style anymore. He's an excellent player, but so is Zaniolo. The difference between the two is that Zaniolo can contribute more to us. Not only in the long term, but also when it comes to his playing style and his physical abilities.

Did you see us play the last two seasons? If yes, that will answer your question. He was so good when we still played in a 4-2-3-1 formation with a fast build up, but today there is no pace, no passion and no beauty in our game at all. Dybala is wasted in this system. We need someone who can contribute his physical abilities to our game, especially with Pirlo's new project in mind (possession/pressing related football). If we get an offer around 100+ million for Dybala, we should accept it. As I said before, I think that Dybala is a fantastic player but I don't think that he's the right player for us right now. He would do much better at a club that is more open to attacking football than we are.
It still amazes me that our management thought that Ramsey and Rabiot were the missing puzzle pieces to win the CL with Sarri.

He's the biggest parasite in our squad, mentality wise. He ruined our CL final 2017 in the halftime break and said (after we got eliminated by Lyon) that the league title was our only goal this season anyway. He has such a loser mentality and shouldn't have been brought back in the first place tbh. The Milan transfer was not a mistake on his part, he was kicked out by Allegri.
Napoli retired the number 10.
Wasn't he in Westworld season 2? The tech guy of the Delos extraction team.
So we can't get Suarez, right?
Lmao. Best summary of this transfer I've ever read.
There's no way CR7 will play as a striker. He hates that. I would use Dybala as a no. 10 in a 4-3-3.

He played in a similiar role in 2017 (in a 4-2-3-1). That was his best season yet. Also, our defense was pretty solid back then. That wouldn't have been possible without Mandzukic of course, but Kulusevski has also a very good workrate.

I can't see any other formation in which CR7 plays as a LW, that also includes a real 9 and in which Dybala doesn't play as a RW (where he is wasted). It has to be a formation with a no. 10 position but also with wingers.
Zidane, Allegri and Sarri already tried that and he hated it. Also, Pirlo already said that he prefers a 4-3-3.

That could work. But then I'm worried about our CB situation. We need more depth to play with a 3-man defense. Rugani is not good enough, Chiellini is almost done, Bonucci... sorry, but he's overrated + he isn't getting younger. I think the whole CR7 / Dybala dilemma is a bigger problem than we thought. CR7 needs his 4-3-3, while Dybala doesn't fit in a 4-3-3. These both players are incompatible to each other when it comes to find a formation for both of them. It's not only a waste of talent but also a waste of money (wages). I really hope that Pirlo finds a way to play both of them successfully.

Left forward is not a second striker. Del Piero was a typical second striker. Tevez was a second striker. Even Dybala was a second striker in his first season at Juve. Ronaldo is a winger and he prefers to play as a winger.
https://footballinside.net/2020/08/04/cristiano-ronaldo-considering-juventus-exit-if-maurizio-sarri-stays-on/

The entire "surgery" thing makes no sense. In 1977, Zero visited Snake in the hospital and asked Ocelot which of the two was the real one. That means that Zero couldn't distinguish between the two, which indicates that the surgery was already been made at this point. It's even more confusing that the surgery actually took place in mission 46, because there is a "48 hours later" timeskip instead of the character creation.
Big Boss never had a surgery. Otherwise he couldn't have appeared at the end of MGSV and MGS4.
Yea but he never looked like the medic.
If we want to play with a 3-man defense, we need at least one additional CB. We've only two good CB's at this point (De Ligt and Demiral).
Zaniolo should be our number one target next summer.
Chiellini? He's done. Bonucci? Overrated (always has been). Rugani? Not good enough for Juve. 5 CB's for 3 positions and only 2 of them are quality players. You can't even rotate with these players.

That's what I'm saying the whole time, but nobody wants to hear that. Our defense is our biggest problem right now, especially if Pirlo wants to play with a 3-man defense. We have no depth and no quality at all in our defense. De Ligt is our only CB I would call "world class" and he's out until november. This could be a desaster. If Demiral doesn't deliver, we're fucked.
Imagine Messi and Ronaldo both playing for Piemonte Calcio in FIFA 21.
You don't play with 5 in the back when you want to press your opponent. You need a strong midfield for that. Also, Kulusevski on the bench is a huge waste. I don't see this formation either.

Nice little story, thanks for sharing. Barzagli is one of the most underrated defender of all time in my opinion. He even won the world cup in 2006. What this guy was capable of in his mid-late 30s is incredible (especially how fast he was despite of his age). A Juve legend through and through.

Richarlison from Everton. He's not world class, but he can be a solid striker in a good system. He's 23 years old and still has a lot of time to improve. Edit: I forgot the fact that he's a Brazilian, so he isn't an option for this summer.

That's inevitable if we want a young striker as a long term solution.

I just wanted to watch the first couple of minutes to see what kind of documentary this is and then I watched the whole thing. This is the only CR7 documentary that kept me interested for its entire length. I'm still thinking about it. Great work.

We don't need a striker who plays every game. We have Kulusevski and Dybala who can play different roles in the attack. But it's important to have a back up striker for specific games or for fitness reasons. I think Morata is a good choice here.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about Amour
WRITING.TEXT: Is there any known reason why this song has only been performed once to this day? It's such a beautiful and underrated song imo. I remember hearing that there were technical reasons, but I don't know if that's true.

When my dad drove me to the kindergarten, he played Engel and I immediately fell in love with the song. From this day on, my dad played Rammstein every single morning while driving me to the kindergarten. I still remember when Mutter got released and we left an hour earlier to hear the entire album before he dropped me off. So I would say I grew up with Rammstein.
This looks so real. Great shot.
That's right, but we don't have 50 million to spend right now. Maybe we can get Aouar in January.

We should play a consistent formation, so that the players get used to it. That's important when you play against big teams in europe, to have a formation you can rely on. I don't think you can compete with a 3-man defense in europe, the past showed that and we shouldn't make the same mistake again. We reached both CL finals with a 4-man defense and should stick to it. Offensively we should play with 2 true wingers and a number 9. Ronaldo can play on his favorised position (LW), Chiesa/Bernadeschi on the RW and Morata as our number 9. It's still up to Pirlo to find a position for Dybala and Kulusevski. I think both are best as a no. 10, behind the strikers. But we could also try to play them between Ronaldo and the RW, but I don't know if that works out. We have a lot of (young) players who can play on different positions, that's great, but it's still important to have "that one" standard formation, but that's just my opinion.
Me too. Don't tell anyone, but I was 7 when I played the game on my dad's PS2 (he didn't know). I had to use cheats to pass the first level, I was so bad. Great memories.
